item.description: Grass Fire - Now Contained; INC#0944; 03:13PM; NB 5 Fwy x San Fernando Mission Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rEfvlU; Mission Hills; Approximately two-acre grass fire burning uphill with light wind between Laurel Canyon and the Golden State Freeway. Crews have anchored the fire and deployed hose lines up the flanks to surround it. Forward progress has been stopped in approximately 20 minutes. No injuries. Cause under investigation. Nothing further.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC15 E18 E275 E287 E298 E7 E75 E87 E90 EM15 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA88 T75 T87 T98; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

Traffic Collision; INC#1518; 10:04PM; 100 N Avenue 52; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dnZ1WG; Highland Park; Multi-vehicle collision with at least 4 patients, including at least two were reportedly pedestrians. No further details. Media Inquires: LAPD Central Traffic Division (Incident (4091+ 4094); FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; E12 E212 E44 RA12 RA55 T12; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#0517; 10:16AM; Sullivan Ridge Trail; MAP: https://bit.ly/3didLGn; Brentwood; LAFD ground and air response to a young adult male mountain bicyclist in fair condition with lower back pain after falling from his bike on a remote section of the Gape Sale Mountain Bike Trail near Sullivan Canyon. A hovering LAFD rescue helicopter will hoist him aboard, and LAFD flight Paramedics will provide in-flight care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO2 BC9 E69 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA69 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0950; 02:30PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; Van Nuys; 36 Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, discover, confine and fully extinguish fire within the walls of one three-story unit (2 occupied floors over garage), in a residential condominium fourplex. One adult male civilian is being medically evaluated at scene by LAFD Paramedics for smoke exposure. His condition and likelihood for hospital transport was not specified. Though the precise cause of the fire has yet to be determined, the injured man (yet unknown if resident or worker) states he was performing plumbing 'hot work' when the fire erupted; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E288 E289 E290 E37 E7 E81 RA100 RA73 T88 T89 T90; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0950; 02:13PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; Van Nuys; PRELIM: 3 story condominium (2 occupied floors over parking) with fire on the 3rd floor.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E288 E289 E290 E37 E7 E81 RA100 RA73 T88 T89 T90; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Explosion; INC#0346; 08:20AM; 5640 N Farmdale Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ehoa0Q; North Hollywood; The explosion occurred in a subterranean electrical vault located in the apartment building's garden space at the front (west side between the street and building) and directly adjacent to the 32,150 square-foot, 37-unit, 3 story apartment building comprised of 2 floors of apartments over parking. The forceful blast, heard over a wide area, as well as concrete debris from the electrical vault's lid, caused visible damage to the eve line of the structure, and broke multiple apartment windows. There was no fire, and no injuries have been reported. The City of Los Angeles Department of Building and Safety (ETA 9:00-9:30 AM) will perform a detailed inspection to determine if the building remains safe for occupancy. LADWP is also en route, no ETA.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E260 E287 E60 RA86 RA860 SQ87 T60 T87; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Explosion; INC#0346; 07:45AM; 5640 N Farmdale Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ehoa0Q; North Hollywood; PRELIM: Apparent explosion involving a subterranean electrical vault with structural damage (including broken windows) reported at a nearby 32,150 square-foot, 37-unit, 3 story apartment building (2 occupied floors over parking). No fire. No injury yet reported. LADWP and Department of Building and Safety en route with unknown ETA. ; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E260 E287 E60 RA86 RA860 SQ87 T60 T87; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0836; 01:23PM; 146 E 66th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Eju6Xd; Florence; KNOCKDOWN: 29 firefighters extinguished the fire in 22 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to one room in the home (now updated to a duplex). Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E21 E221 E233 E26 E266 SQ21 T21 T33 T66; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0836; 01:01PM; 146 E 66th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Eju6Xd; Florence; Two story, single family dwelling with smoke showing from the first floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode and have located the seat of the fire in the living room.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E21 E221 E233 E26 E266 T21 T33 T66; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0367; 08:48AM; 15354 W Archwood St; MAP: https://bit.ly/31jRK7e; Van Nuys; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters extinguished the fire in 19 minutes. This was determined to be an outside fire that extended into the vacant structure. Firefighters quickly addressed the exposed building and limited the fire to the eves. One adult female is being evaluated for unknown (at this time) medical complaint. No further details.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E90 RA100 RA39 RA81 T39 T88; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart
